intro: Banisteria orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco banisteria, is a climbing plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, red or orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
